body:
Local and exit register caused too much loads to the storage and waste a lot of endpoint ID for nothing. And entry span is the one could be used for metrics, endpoint dependency, and waste more time to finish register(because more ID required register).

So, from all perspectives, this mechanism should be removed. Actually, this should be removed earlier, but I forgot to propose this.
Could you share the exception?
@tristaZero Still one question, are these SQLs same with H2 or not? Could them be merged together?
English please
Enligsh only, please. Query interfaces are right, should not change in any way because of CLI.

I guess what @aderm mentioned is about the trace order which is similar with what I had met before in https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/1657

I am not sure ShardingSphere plugin how to affect hystrix. Any suggestions?

@wu-sheng Hi, i think so. Actually there are 4 `MySQLXXXXDAO` overwriting some functions of `H2XXXDAO`,  i.e., 
```
MySQLAggregationQueryDAO
MySQLTraceQueryDAO
MySQLAlarmQueryDAO
MySQLLogQueryDAO
```
And i compared with those overwrite functions and found it seems that they return the SAME SQLs. I do not know why those `MySQLXXXDAO` were created, howerver maybe we can try to use `H2XXXDAO` for `MySQLProvider` and `H2Provider` uniformly.

> Which storage are you using? If you are just using quick-start, which is a memory mode. We highlighted that in the document already.

but I use elasticsearch.
Then you should analysis the memory dump file. We may could have a clue there.

> Then you should analysis the memory dump file. We may could have a clue there.

thanks, I will try.
It they are using the same SQL, they should be merged. I remember they are different, but not sure. If you are sure, please process that.

> @kezhenxu94 Hi zhenxu, which checkstyple.xml is correct one for `checkstyple plugin`? I tried to add `/apm-checkstyle/checkStyple.xml` for `checkstyple plugin setting`, however i got exception as follows:

`/apm-checkstyle/checkStyple.xml` is the right one, but the reported exception does no harm, just ignore it because the plugin cannot recognize `${checkstyle.header.file}`, it's for license header checks
